definition[0]: to go or travel to different places
example[0]: We had to use public transport to get around.
example[1]: Itâ€™s quite easy to get around London.
definition[1]: if news or information gets around, it is told to a lot of people
example[2]: News of the accident soon got around.
example[3]: Word got around that the department might be closed.
definition[2]: to avoid something that is difficult or causes problems for you
example[4]: I think we should be able to get around most of these problems.
example[5]: She was always very clever at getting around the rules.
definition[3]: to find a way of dealing with a problem, especially by avoiding it altogether
example[6]: Gasoline was smuggled across the border to get around an international trade embargo.
example[7]: The US banks searched for ways to get round these restrictions.
